**Government Tender Announcement**

**Title:** Fire Alarm and Sensor Monitoring Services for F Division (Saskatchewan) Facilities

**Reference Number:** CB-135-32809468
**Amendment Number:** 5
**Solicitation Number:** M5000-23-00507/A
**Publication Date:** 2023-12-18
**Tender Closing Date and Time:** 2024-01-12T15:00:00

**Background:**

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is seeking a supplier to provide Fire Alarm and Sensor Monitoring Services and Fire Alarm Panel Inspection Services for multiple locations in Saskatchewan. The contract will be for a two-year period, with an option to extend for up to three additional one-year periods.

**Security Clearance:**

This procurement contains a security requirement. The supplier is expected to comply with all relevant security regulations and procedures.

**Mandatory Technical Criteria:**

A bid must meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be considered responsive. Evaluation will be based on the Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price.

**Procurement Method:**

This procurement is a Competitive - Open Bidding process.

**Trade Agreements:**

This procurement is subject to the following trade agreements: Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement, World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, and others.

**Regions of Opportunity:**

This procurement is open to suppliers worldwide.

**Regions of Delivery:**

Delivery locations are in Saskatchewan.

**Contact Information:**

For more information, please contact Shawn Balaski at shawn.m.balaski@rcmp-grc.gc.ca or 780670-8592.

**Documentation:**

Access the tender documents through [Canada Buy Tender website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities).

**Note:**

This procurement is conditionally set aside under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business. Suppliers are required to certify that they qualify as Indigenous businesses and commit to complying with all requirements of the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Businesses. Le Canada se réserve le droit de négocier tout achat avec les fournisseurs et les documents peuvent être soumis dans l'une ou l'autre des langues officielles du Canada.
